Literature Review: The development of organoid models has significantly advanced our understanding of cancer biology, and incorporating immune cells into these models has opened new avenues for research in cancer immunotherapy. The complexity of the tumor microenvironment is crucial for the efficacy of immunotherapies, and organoid coculture models have been developed to recapitulate this environment. This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the various organoid immune coculture methods, highlighting their strengths and limitations, and discussing the potential of these models to interrogate the tumor immune microenvironment.
